intro: Votomita guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan voodoo vine, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its long, woody stems that can reach lengths of several meters. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and typically have a heart-shaped or ovate outline. Votomita guianensis is often found in humid, shaded understory environments where it relies on its tendrils to climb towards sunlight.
